location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in the file are arranged chronologically. There are file notes at the end, on folios 24-25. The notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 26; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-16; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 26; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-16; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence and telegrams regarding the import of dogs and livestock into Bahrain, restrictions and compulsory anti rabies vaccinations.The main correspondents are the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain, the Director of Customs and Port Officer in Bahrain, British Overseas Airways Corporation, the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, and the Political Agent at Bahrain. There are also requests for dogs to transit into Bahrain.

name.namePart: Adviser to the Government of Bahrain
Director of Customs and Port Officer
